review: frustrating to set up, constant disconnects from wireless, no hbo go or twc access.  Once I finally got it working - there were some issues with it even powering up using the power plug and cord provided - and it still said no power was hooked up afterward - took far longer to update than I would have expected.  I guess I shouldn't expect much tho - it's basically worthless at this point tho. At least it was only 20 bucks.
author: jared Young

review: It's not possible to project your computer/tablet/phone screen to the TV. It seems this functionality is available from only Amazon Fire Tablet and Phone. I was hoping to replace my Chromecast with Fire TV stick because Chromecast doesn't come with a remote, but not able to project computer/tablet/phone screen on TV is a deal breaker for me.
author: M. Agarwal

review: Awesome so far preferable if not better than the chromecast only issue I had was with the setup had to try three times to get to set up but then it finally setup and works for me
author: Benjamin

review: This is an excellent little device. We use it almost every night.
author: Matthew R Weasel

review: After having 2 kindle Fire devices I already knew what I was in for with the Fire Stick. Small, easy to set up all the features of prime, what's to complain about. I guess the only flaw is there is no actual off button/switch. The control is small and there is enough room for an on control power button. You have to physically unplug the power cord to turn it off. Asaide from that I still give it 5 stars.
author: invictus syd

review: Wish the Fire TV Stick had a better range than it does.  Doesn't work unless it is less than 10 feet from my router.
author: Elliot J. Saatzer

review: Easy set up and connectivity through WI-FI.  Works just like the Fire-TV (which I have and use daily for seamless streaming  movies from Prime and Netflix) but with fewer options through the remote.  Would recommend.  Just make sure there is an outlet near by as it has to be plugged in for its power source.
author: fool4fish "radmathman"

review: Easy to set up, fairly easy to navigate. Once they add HBOGO, it will be 5 stars!
